conversation.text: hi, what kind of beans are needed for this recipe?
Hi! I have pinto beans. Can you teach me how to cook them?
yes, the first step is to put 1 pound of dry pinto beans and 1/2 teaspoon of kosher salt into them
evidence: place 1 pound (0.45 kg) of dry pinto beans and 1/2 teaspoon (3 g) of kosher salt into it

conversation.text: Do I need to add water?
yes, you need to pour enough water to cover the beans by 1/2 inches
evidence: Pour in enough water to cover the beans by 1 ⁄2 inches (3.8 cm)

conversation.text: nice! the next step is to bring the beans to a boil before putting them in oven. once they are boiling, carefully transfer the hot pot to a preheated oven
evidence: Bring the beans to a boil before putting them in the oven.

conversation.text: Are we baking the beans with an oven? What temperature should I set?
What do you mean by "after th"

I apologise, I just accidentally pressed enter before finishing the sentence. The beans should be baked in a oven after having boiled. The oven should be preheated at 250 degrees and baked for 75 minutes
evidence: Bake the pinto beans for 75 minutes.

conversation.text: Thank you! The beans have been taken to the preheated oven now. How can I check when the beans are ready to take out?

Great! You can check the beans after they have cooked for 45 minutes to ensure that theres still water covering them. Let them cook until they are tender and ready to eat (probably another 30 minutes). If they look dry when you check them, just top them off with more water
evidence: Check the beans after they've cooked for 45 minutes to ensure that there's still water covering the beans

conversation.text: Sounds easy! Are we done after that?
Yes! the cooking is all done. Now you can just use the beans in a recipe or store them in the fridge. They can stay up to 5 days or be frozen for up to 6 months
evidence: Use the pintos in a recipe or store them in the refrigerator.

conversation.text: Got it! This is much easier than expected. Thank you and bye!

recipe.title: How to Cook Pinto Beans Quickly

procedure.summary: Preheat the oven to 250 °F (121 °C) and put the beans and salt in a pot.
procedure.description: Set a large pot on the stove and place 1 pound (0.45 kg) of dry pinto beans and 1/2 teaspoon (3 g) of kosher salt into it. If you see any broken beans, discard them.

procedure.summary: Pour in enough water to cover the beans by 1 ⁄2 inches (3.8 cm).
procedure.description: Since the size of your pot will determine how much water you need to add, pour in enough water so the beans are completely submerged.

procedure.summary: Bring the beans to a boil before putting them in the oven.
procedure.description: Turn the burner to high and heat the beans until the water begins to boil vigorously. Then turn off the burner and put the lid on the pot. Carefully transfer the hot pot to the preheated oven.

procedure.summary: Bake the pinto beans for 75 minutes.
procedure.description: Keep the pot covered so the water doesn't boil out as the beans bake. Check the beans after they've cooked for 45 minutes to ensure that there's still water covering the beans. Let them cook for another 30 minutes or until they're tender. If the beans look dry at the halfway point, pour in boiling water.

procedure.summary: Use the pintos in a recipe or store them in the refrigerator.
procedure.description: Remove the beans from the oven and eat them in your favorite recipe. If you want to use them later, refrigerate them in an airtight container for up to 3 to 5 days or freeze them for up to 6 months.
